name: sfchronicle
text:
Gov. Gavin Newsom supports an effort to let residents vote on renaming Fort Bragg, the North Coast city named after a Confederate general who enslaved more than 100 African Americans.

Story by @DustinGardiner: https://t.co/NA1xPNlsZc

name: sfchronicle
text: “They came to Oakland to kill cops”: Steven Carrillo, suspected of killing Santa Cruz County deputy on June 6, also charged in fatal shooting of federal guard in Oakland a week earlier, and has been linked to right-wing extremist group. https://t.co/vvITWH3NFd

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text:

Read more from @TheJDMorris & @LizzieJohnsonnn: https://t.co/XOdli5Jj1C https://t.co/85NsouBkHB

name: sfchronicle
text: If a number of star NBA players decide resuming play isn't worth it — prioritizing health, financial concerns and the focus on Black Lives Matter — the “season” will be considered an awkward, inauthentic novelty, writes @Bruce_Jenkins1. https://t.co/1x8NmCcQRF

text: Six California counties — Imperial, Kings, Madera, Placer, San Joaquin and Yolo — have seen average new cases triple since the state began reopening. https://t.co/A5vPWROUhf

text: An anti-inflammatory steroid significantly reduced fatalities in seriously ill COVID-19 patients during a drug trial, marking the first time any coronavirus treatment has proven to prevent deaths. https://t.co/2k7OSStXKY

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Mateo County health officials are expected to issue a new health order this week after state officials approved the county’s attestation report on Tuesday, officials said.

@abauman2 has the details: https://t.co/fXsuFv73s2

name: sfchronicle
text: A statue of Christopher Columbus and Queen Isabella that has been in the Capitol in Sacramento for more than a century will be removed, Democratic legislative leaders said Tuesday. https://t.co/ApK7RotkCI

text: The man accused of killing a Santa Cruz County Sheriff’s official and an Oakland security guard had ties to the right-wing “Boogaloo” movement. Here's what we know. https://t.co/FHOPcAw0vJ

text: How did @Warriors center Marquese Chriss fare this season? He appears to have found his NBA niche and has a chance to open 2020-21 as the starting center, writes @Con_Chron. https://t.co/rBM2bhfhl7

Nail salons, massage parlors, tattoo shops and other personal care services will be allowed to reopen in Solano County on Friday, county officials announce.

name: sfchronicle
text:
Coronavirus live updates: Officials in Brazil reported 34,918 new cases of the coronavirus and 1,282 additional deaths Tuesday, according to Reuters. Brazil has confirmed both the second-most cases (923,189) and deaths (45,241) in the world after the U.S.
https://t.co/kdsfaame6l

name: sfchronicle
text:
LIVE UPDATES: Google has pulled ad revenue from ZeroHedge, a right-wing blog, and warned The Federalist it would do the same after learning the comment section of both sites consistently violated Google’s policy against derogatory and dangerous language.

https://t.co/PEgXlVyjWa

text:
These Bay Area restaurants are open for outdoor dining. 

https://t.co/l1fcdMLHWd

name: sfchronicle
text:
SF Sheriff’s Office has outlined police reform steps, including:

• Early identification of staff “at risk for future adverse behavior”

• Updated de-escalation training that includes cultural competency

• Including community in implicit bias training

https://t.co/F4Q3BHS7LW

name: sfchronicle
text:
The San Francisco Board of Supervisors unanimously voted to ask Gov. Gavin Newsom for permission to restart certain parts of the city’s economy — like fully opening restaurants, bars and salons — faster than the state’s current timeline.

https://t.co/h8DGwKrdyM

name: sfchronicle
text: At his brother's memorial, Terrence Floyd asked people to "educate yourself" on racism and systematic injustice. Here are 6 books that can help your kids do just that. https://t.co/mye4Fc0ZCe

name: sfchronicle
text:
Live updates: More than 1,000 flights in and out of Beijing have been canceled, the AP reported citing Chinese media outlets. Beijing has reported more than 130 new cases in recent days with many tied to one wholesale market, according to reports.

https://t.co/q0FpdE9eSs

text:
Some state prison inmates will soon be eligible for a “community supervision” program meant to protect staff and inmates from coronavirus, the CDCR said. Eligible inmates will “remain under close supervision for the duration of their sentence.” 

https://t.co/4mpBRCxjQ7

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
LIVE UPDATES: Juan Orlando Hernández, the president of Honduras, said he has tested positive for the coronavirus, according to Reuters. Hernández said he is receiving treatment after having mild symptoms and will continue working remotely.

https://t.co/tc6cIXovQ6

text:
“It looked about 15 months old. Healthy and young and trying to get out of town. Obviously confused.”

name: sfchronicle
text: Chronicle food writers Soleil Ho and Justin Phillips are launching a new kind of podcast: Extra Spicy. Ask them anything — about restaurant life, cookbooks, or bizarro food world happenings in a live #AMA on @reddit. Go to https://t.co/PrybsZTRqI at 2:00 p.m. on Thursday to join. https://t.co/7L5YlMtr5L

text:

@PhilMatier has more: https://t.co/6GsfiwOuTP https://t.co/x7gjcvHzvn

name: sfchronicle
text:

Listen 🎧: https://t.co/FPwdIKuiKN https://t.co/IQr6GO1ay1

text:

MLB should shake up its bargaining team with the union and send former @SFGiants Nick Hundley and Gregor Blanco to the table, along with ex-pitcher Chris Young, to build trust. The league now employs all three.
